channel.title: TQA Hugo Xsite
channel.description: Recent content on TQA Hugo Xsite

item.title: Albert Einstein on Math
item.description: Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas. One seeks the most general ideas of operation which will bring together in simple, logical and unified form the largest possible circle of formal relationships. In this effort toward logical beauty spiritual formulas are discovered necessary for the deeper penetration into the laws of nature. It is mathematics that offers the exact natural sciences a certain measure of security which, without mathematics, they could not attain.

item.title: Lie Groups
item.description: Definition and examples A Lie group is a group (set with an operation of composition) and a topological manifold (space that locally resembles Euclidian space, but which may be curved or distorted on the global level ), such that the law of composition is continuous (small changes in the elements being composed produce small changes in the result). Simplest example: set of all rotations of a circle. More challenging example: group of all rotations of tri-dimensional space that preserve a fixed origin.

item.title: Galois
item.description: What Galois theory can prove ‚Ä¶‚Äã insolubility by radicals of a specific quintic polynomial with integer coefficients duplicating the Cube trisecting the angle squarring the circle construction of regular polygons (17-gon) solution of cubic and quartic equations structure of finite fields the Fundamental theorem of algebra trancendence of $ \pi $

item.title: Asciidoc Test
item.description: Sunset from articles/asciidoc-test/` local directory Asciidoctor Demo Footnotes fnote1.[1] (fnote1.footnote:one\[Text footnote n¬∞1 blabla]) fnote2.[2] (fnote2.footnote:\[Text of footnote n¬∞ 2 blablabla]) fnote3.[1] (fnote3.footnote:one\[]) Abbreviations include command coded: include::acronymns.txt[] containing: :afaik: pass:[<abbr title="As far as I know">AFAIK</abbr>] :hateoas: pass:[<abbr title="Hypermedia as the Engine of Application State ">HATEOAS</abbr>] :html: pass:[<abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr>] ... AFAIK HTML is a publishing language. IMHO or IMHO it‚Äôs non case-sensitive. HATEOAS REST RGPD en fran√ßais GDPR in english

item.title: Eugene Wigner on Math
item.description: Tomography The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Mathematics in the Natural Sciences by Eugene Wigner Darmouth College - Reading List The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Mathematics in the Natural Sciences, in Communications in Pure and Applied Mathematics, vol. 13, No. I (February 1960). New York: John Wiley & Sons, Inc. Copyright ¬© 1960 by John Wiley & Sons, Inc. Mathematics, rightly viewed, possesses not only truth, but supreme beauty, a beauty cold and austere, like that of sculpture, without appeal to any part of our weaker nature, without the gorgeous trappings of painting or music, yet sublimely pure, and capable of a stern perfection such as only the greatest art can show.

item.title: Hamming on Math
item.description: The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Mathematics R. W. HAMMING Reprinted From: The American Mathematical Monthly Volume 87 Number 2 February 1980 Prologue It is evident from the title that this is a philosophical discussion. I shall not apologize for the philosophy, though I am well aware that most scientists, engineers, and mathematicians have little regard for it; instead, I shall give this short prologue to justify the approach. Man, so far as we know, has always wondered about himself, the world around him, and what life is all about.

item.title: README
item.description: Activate server on localhost:1313 : %hugo server -D --gc --disableFastRender For creating a new article in adoc : %hugo new articles/title-article.adoc Update git remote repo and web: %git add . %git commit -m "comment" %git push hugo is the main command, used to build your Hugo site. Hugo is a Static Site Generator built by spf13 and friends in Go. Complete documentation is available at gohugo.io/. Usage: hugo [flags] hugo [command] Available Commands:

item.title: Dhammapada
item.description: Si l‚Äôon doit ne retenir qu‚Äôun seul th√®me et d√©signer celui qui soutient tout l‚Äôouvrage, ce ne peut √™tre que le nirvana, l‚Äôextinction des d√©sirs qui conduit √† la lib√©ration d√©finitive. La foi doit √™tre une conviction fond√©e sur une compr√©hension approfondie de la voie choisie. Th√®mes fondateurs de l‚Äôenseignement bouddhique: 1 Le caract√®re impermanent et illusoire du monde. 2 La nature douloureuse de l‚Äôexistence 3 La vanit√© des attachements et des d√©sirs.

item.title: Francois Jullien
item.description: Car, en concevant : une efficacit√© qui ne proc√®de pas par mod√©lisation, Trait√© de l‚Äôefficacit√© une sagesse pour qui avancer une id√©e est d√©j√† verser dans la partialit√© Un sage est sans id√©e une image qui soit moins mim√©tique que vectrice d‚Äô√©nergie La Grande Image n‚Äôa pas de forme un "mal" qui ne soit qu‚Äôobstruction du cours du monde comme de la vie Du Mal/du N√©gatif aussi bien qu‚Äôun "vivre" qui ne soit plus suspendu au bonheur Nourrir Sa Vie

item.title: La litt√©rature pour quoi faire?
item.description: Antoine Compagnon üîñNote La litt√©rature, pour quoi faire ? - Le√ßon inaugurale prononc√©e le jeudi 30 novembre 2006 au Coll√®ge de France. (texte int√©gral) Extraits choisis : Quitter l‚Äô√©loquence pour les math√©matiques, c‚Äôest d‚Äô√™tre d√©go√ªt√© d‚Äôune ma√Ætresse de dix-huit ans et devenir amoureux d‚Äôune vieille Jean-Louis Guez de Balzac, lettre √† M. de Tissandier, 23 mars 1628. Val√©ry ne pensait rien de bon des historiens de la litt√©rature: Ces messieurs ne servent √† rien, ne disent rien.

item.title: Francis Bacon
item.description: Of Studies ‚Äì Francis Bacon (Text) To spend too much time in studies is sloth Studies serve for delight, for ornament, and for ability. Their chief use for delight, is in privateness and retiring; for ornament, is in discourse; and for ability, is in the judgement and disposition of business. For expert men can execute, and perhaps judge of particulars, one by one; but the general counsels, and the plots and marshalling of affairs, come best from those that are learned.

item.title: Page de couverture du Colmez
item.description: 1√®re de couverture du cours de Pierre Colmez √† l‚ÄôX (absolute path) Lagrange 1771: (√† 5h du groupe de photos) $ |G| = |H|.|G/H| $ (Colmez p.41: Le cardinal de G groupe fini est multiple du cardinal du sous-groupe H et du quotient G/H ) Fourier 1811: (√† 9h) $ \phi(t) = \int e^{2i\pi t x}\hat\phi(x) dx $ ( p.335 - $ \hat\phi $ transform√©e de Fourier de $ \phi \in \mathscr L^1 (R^m) $ pour tout x,t $ \in R^m $)
